meanings.definition: Shy or modest in a way that is intended to be alluring or attractive.
meanings.sent1: She gave a coy smile to the boy she liked.
meanings.sent2: The actress played a coy character in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The cat was being coy, pretending not to want attention.
meanings.sent4: The coy invitation left him wondering about her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: Her coy behavior made her even more intriguing.

meanings.definition: Showing a reluctance to give information or talk about something.
meanings.sent1: He was coy about his plans for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The witness remained coy during the interrogation.
meanings.sent3: The coy suspect kept changing the topic to avoid questions.
meanings.sent4: Her coy responses only fueled their curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The coy politician dodged the reporter's questions skillfully.
